intro: Limonium lilacinum, commonly known as sea holly, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of Europe and western Asia. It is characterized by its striking blue to violet flowers that bloom in late summer and early autumn. The plant has silvery-gray foliage and is often found growing in sandy or gravelly soils along the shorelines. Limonium lilacinum is a member of the Plumbagaceae family and is known for its drought tolerance and ability to thrive in saline environments. It is widely cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value and hardy nature.
